body.p: To His Excellency Gov. Thomas E. Bramlette. Gov. of Ky.

We the undersigned Jurors, of the Jury who tried and convicted Wm Schofield, at the October term of the Jefferson Criminal Court for 1863; and whose petition for his pardon accompanies this, would respectfully recommend his case to the your Excellency as one of. merit; and one in which Executive clemency would be proper.

Respectfully.
Edwd J. Wilson
M S. Gross
D J Bowles
Henry Dennis
F. W Mertz
J. V. Escott
Squire Lochry
W. T. Lewis

This is to certify that I was one of the Jury who tried the afsd Wm Schofield; I was about Oakland about the time the money was alledged to have been Stolen; I knew Weaver ^he was a wagon master^ The man who lost the money, or Said he lost it. I heard Weaver tell about it frequently; and he never heard him tell the Same Story twice; he was So frequently drunk; and he told so many different tales about it; and he had around him Such a bad Set a men; that I was led to beleave that it was uncertain whether he lost it atall; or if he did he, I am Satisfied knew nothing aboot who got it. I was on the Jury and was greatly Surprized that Schofield plead guilty; but having plead guilty we could not do any thing else but find him So. I Sign the petition with pleasure and earnestly ask your executive clemency..
